body_html:
Hello drpngx,
Thanks for your reply.
I am trying to get stack trace. Need to figure out how can I do that on hanged processes. What is confusing to me is that, sometimes it runs up to completion of training, but most of time it hangs somewhere in middle. After printing the epoch loss line it should be in the "sess.run(trainig_iterator_init)". Any guess about why its behaving like this?

body:
Hello drpngx,
Thanks for your reply.
I am trying to get stack trace. Need to figure out how can I do that on hanged processes. What is confusing to me is that, sometimes it runs up to completion of training, but most of time it hangs somewhere in middle. After printing the epoch loss line it should be in the "sess.run(trainig_iterator_init)". Any guess about why its behaving like this?
